description.narrative: The project is expected to have strong developmental impact by: 1) enhancing access to finance for SMEs which will in turn increase job creation and private sector development overall as SMEs are a main contributor to job creation and private sector development in Pakistan. 2) Developing Islamic banking through supporting BAFL''s growth in Islamic banking, which will help develop this relatively new and important market segment in Pakistan which has strong market potential. 3) IFC''s equity will provide the required support to BAFL thereby improving the Bank''s competitiveness and in turn competition within the banking sector at large. 4) Sending a positive signal to the market through IFC''s engagement with BAFL at a time when MENA and Pakistan are faced with economic and political challenges.

The proposed project consists of an equity investment for up to US$67.48 million in Bank Alfalah (BAFL, or Bank), a commercial bank organized under the laws of Pakistan, which will help the Bank pursue its growth plans. Through the investment, IFC will support the Bank in growing the Banks conventional and Islamic banking operations and increase penetration into priority areas like SME banking, access to finance and agri finance. BAFL is the 5th largest bank in Pakistan, with a 5.8% market share in terms of total assets. As of March 2014, the Banks total assets stood at US$6.3bn, net loan of US$2.6bn, total equity of US$310mn, and net income of US$46mn in CY 13. The Bank operates a network of 577 branches (as of May-14) in 196 cities across Pakistan that includes 424 conventional banking branches, 10 overseas branches, 140 Islamic banking branches and 1 wholesale banking unit with operations in Pakistan, Bangladesh, Bahrain and Afghanistan.
